cover.text: Questions are an accurate representation of actual exam content
Pass this and you will pass the exam no problemo

question.text: Which three tasks can be performed using SQL functions built into Oracle Database?

choices.label: A
choices.text: Displaying a date in nondefault format

choices.label: B
choices.text: Finding the number of characters in an expression

choices.label: C
choices.text: Substituting a character string in a text expression with a specified string

choices.label: D
choices.text: Combining more than two columns or expressions into a single column in the output

Which three delete statements are valid?

Which query will generate the required result?

In the customers table, the CUST_CITY column contains the value 'Paris' for the CUST_FIRST_NAME 'Abigail'.
Evaluate the following query:

What would be the outcome?
View the Exhibit and evaluate the structure and data in the CUST_STATUS table.
https://s3.amazonaws.com/electron-exam/oracle-1z0-061/6e1.PNG
You issue the following SQL statement:
https://s3.amazonaws.com/electron-exam/oracle-1z0-061/6e2.PNG
Which statement is true regarding the execution of the above query?

choices.label: A
choices.text: It produces an error because the AMT_SPENT column contains a null value.

choices.label: B
choices.text: It displays a bonus of 1000 for all customers whose AMT_SPENT is less than CREDIT_LIMIT.

choices.label: C
choices.text: It displays a bonus of 1000 for all customers whose AMT_SPENT equals CREDIT_LIMIT, or AMT_SPENT is null.

choices.label: D
choices.text: It produces an error because the TO_NUMBER function must be used to convert the result of the NULLIF function before it can be used by the NVL2 function.

question.text: Which normal form is a table in if it has no multi-valued attributes and no partial dependencies?
Examine the types and examples of relationships that follow:
1. One-to-One    a) Teacher to Student
2. One-to-Many   b) Employess to Manager
3. Many-to-One   c) Person to SSN
4. Many-to-Many  d) Customers to Products
Which option indicates the correctly matched relationships?
View the Exhibit and examine the structure of the customers table.
https://s3.amazonaws.com/electron-exam/oracle-1z0-061/9a.PNG

Using the customers table, you need to generate a report that shows an increase in the credit limit by 15% for all customers. Customers whose credit limit has not been entered should have the message 'Not Available' displayed.
Which SQL statement would produce the required result?
https://s3.amazonaws.com/electron-exam/oracle-1z0-061/9b.PNG
View the Exhibit and examine the structure of the promotions table.
https://s3.amazonaws.com/electron-exam/oracle-1z0-061/10a.PNG
Evaluate the following SQL statement:
https://s3.amazonaws.com/electron-exam/oracle-1z0-061/10b.PNG
Which statement is true regarding the outcome of the above query?

choices.label: A
choices.text: It shows COST_REMARK for all the promos in the table.

choices.label: B
choices.text: It produces an error because subquery produces an error.

choices.label: C
choices.text: It show COST_REMARK for all the promos in the promo category 'TV'

choices.label: D
choices.text: It produces an error because subqueries cannot be used with the CASE expression.

question.text: Examine the structure and data of the CUST_TRANS table:
https://s3.amazonaws.com/electron-exam/oracle-1z0-061/11a.PNG
Dates are stored in the default date format dd-mon-rr in the CUST_TRANS table. Which three SQL statements would execute successfully?

choices.label: C
choices.text: SELECT transamt FROM cust_trans WHERE custno > "11";

choices.label: E
choices.text: SELECT custno + 'A' FROM cust_trans WHERE transamt > 2000;

question.text: View the Exhibit and examine the data in the products table.
https://s3.amazonaws.com/electron-exam/oracle-1z0-061/12a.PNG
You need to display product names from the products table that belong to the 'software/other' category with minimum prices as either 2000 or 4000 and no unit of measure.
You issue the following query:
https://s3.amazonaws.com/electron-exam/oracle-1z0-061/12b.PNG
Which statement is true regarding the above query?

choices.label: A
choices.text: It generates an error because the condition specified for PROD_UNIT_OF_MEASURE is not valid.

choices.label: B
choices.text: It executes successfully and returns the required result.

choices.label: C
choices.text: It generates an error because the condition specified for the prod category column is not valid.

choices.label: D
choices.text: It executes successfully but returns no result.

question.text: You need to display the date 11-oct-2007 in words as ‘Eleventh of October, Two Thousand Seven'. Which SQL statement would give the required result?
https://s3.amazonaws.com/electron-exam/oracle-1z0-061/13a.PNG
Exhibit contains the structure of PRODUCTS table:
https://s3.amazonaws.com/electron-exam/oracle-1z0-061/14a.PNG
Evaluate the following query:
https://s3.amazonaws.com/electron-exam/oracle-1z0-061/14b.PNG
What would be the outcome of executing the above SQL statement?

choices.label: A
choices.text: It shown the names of all products whose list price is less than the maximum list price

choices.label: B
choices.text: It shows the names of products whose list price is the second highest in the table

choices.label: C
choices.text: It shows the names of all products in the table

question.text: Which two statements are true regarding constraints?

choices.label: A
choices.text: A column with the unique constraint can contain null values.

choices.label: B
choices.text: All constraints can be defined at the column level as well as the table level.

choices.label: C
choices.text: A constraint can be disabled even if the constraint column contains data.

choices.label: D
choices.text: A foreign key cannot contain null values.

choices.label: E
choices.text: A constraint is enforced only for the insert operation on a table.

question.text: The PART_CODE column in the SPARES table contains the following list of values:
https://s3.amazonaws.com/electron-exam/oracle-1z0-061/16a.PNG
Which statement is true regarding the outcome of the above query?

choices.label: B
choices.text: It displays only the values A%_WQ123 and AB_WQ123

choices.label: D
choices.text: It displays only the values A%_WQ123 and A%BWQ123

choices.label: E
choices.text: It displays only the values A%BWQ123 and AB_WQ123

question.text: If SYSDATE returns 12-JUL-2016, what is returned by the following statement?
SELECT TO_CHAR(SYSDATE, 'fmMONTH, YEAR') FROM DUAL;
(Choose the best answer.)
Which types of constraint require an index?
(Choose all that apply.)
Examine the structure of the EMPLOYEES table:
https://s3.amazonaws.com/electron-exam/oracle-1z0-061/19a.PNG
Which INSERT statement is valid?

choices.label: A
choices.text: INSERT INTO employees(employee_id, first_name, last_name, Hire_date) VALUES ( 1000, ‘John’, ‘Smith’, To_date(‘01/01/01’));

choices.label: B
choices.text: INSERT INTO employees(employee_id, first_name, last_name, hire_date) VALUES ( 1000, ‘John’, ‘Smith’, ’01-Jan-01′);

choices.label: C
choices.text: INSERT INTO employees(employee_id, first_name, last_name, hire_date) VALUES ( 1000, ‘John’, ‘Smith’, ’01 January 01′);

choices.label: D
choices.text: INSERT INTO employees (employee_id, first_name, last_name, hire_date) VALUES ( 1000, ‘John’, ‘Smith’, ‘01/01/01’);

question.text: Which two statements are true regarding the ORDER BY clause?
(Choose Two)

choices.label: A
choices.text: You cannot specify a column name followed by an expression in this clause.

choices.label: B
choices.text: It must be the last clause in the SELECT statement.

choices.label: C
choices.text: It is executed first in the query execution.

choices.label: D
choices.text: It cannot be used in a SELECT statement containing a HAVING clause.

choices.label: E
choices.text: You can specify a combination of numeric positions and column names in this clause.

question.text: Examine the structure of the employees table.
https://s3.amazonaws.com/electron-exam/oracle-1z0-061/21a.PNG
You want to display the maximum and minimum salaries of employees hired 1 year ago. Which two statements would get the correct output?
https://s3.amazonaws.com/electron-exam/oracle-1z0-061/21b.PNG
Which line in the following query contains an error?
https://s3.amazonaws.com/electron-exam/oracle-1z0-061/22a.PNG
You need to create a table with the following column specifications:
1. Employee ID (numeric data type) for each employee
2. Employee Name (character data type) that stores the employee name
3. Hire date, which stores the date of joining the organization for each employee
4. Status (character data type), that contains the value 'active' if no data is entered
5. Resume (character large object [CLOB] data type), which contains the resume submitted by the employee
Which is the correct syntax to create this table?
https://s3.amazonaws.com/electron-exam/oracle-1z0-061/23a.PNG
Which arithmetic operations can be performed on a column by using a SQL function that is built into Oracle database?
(Choose Three)
You work as a database administrator at ABC.com. You study the CUSTOMER table carefully.
https://s3.amazonaws.com/electron-exam/oracle-1z0-061/25a.PNG
Evaluate the following query.
https://s3.amazonaws.com/electron-exam/oracle-1z0-061/25b.PNG
The above query produces an error on execution. What is the reason for the error?

choices.label: A
choices.text: The alias MIDPOINT should be enclosed within double quotation marks for the CUST_CREDIT_LIMIT/2  expression

choices.label: B
choices.text: The MIDPOINT +100 expression gives an error because CUST_CREDIT_LIMIT contains NULL values

choices.label: C
choices.text: The alias NAME should not be enclosed within double quotation marks

choices.label: D
choices.text: An alias cannot be used in an expression

question.text: Which two of the following conditions are equivalent to each other?
The following table describes the DEPARTMENTS table:
https://s3.amazonaws.com/electron-exam/oracle-1z0-061/27a.PNG
Which of the following INSERT statements will raise an exception?

choices.label: B
choices.text: INSERT INTO departments (dept_id, dept_name, location_id) VALUES(280,'Security',1700);

choices.label: D
choices.text: None of these statements will raise an exception.

question.text: Consider the following code segment. How many rows will be in the CARS table after all these statements are executed?
https://s3.amazonaws.com/electron-exam/oracle-1z0-061/28a.PNG
Examine the structure of the sales table:
https://s3.amazonaws.com/electron-exam/oracle-1z0-061/29a.PNG
Evaluate the following create table statement:
https://s3.amazonaws.com/electron-exam/oracle-1z0-061/29b.PNG
Which two statements are true about the creation of the SALES1 table?

choices.label: A
choices.text: The SALES1 table is created with no rows but only a structure.

choices.label: B
choices.text: The SALES1 table would have primary key and unique constraints on the specified columns.

choices.label: C
choices.text: The SALES1 table would not be created because column-specified names in the select and create table clauses do not match.

choices.label: D
choices.text: The SALES1 table would have not null constraint on the specified columns.

choices.label: E
choices.text: The SALES1 table would not be created because of the invalid where clause.

question.text: Examine the description of the EMP_DETAILS table given below:
https://s3.amazonaws.com/electron-exam/oracle-1z0-061/30a.PNG
Which two statements are true regarding SQL statements that can be executed on the EMP_DETAIL table?
(Choose Two)

choices.label: A
choices.text: You can alter the table to include the NOT NULL constraint on the EMP_IMAGE column

choices.label: B
choices.text: An EMP_IMAGE column cannot be included in the ORDER BY clause

choices.label: C
choices.text: An EMP_IMAGE column can be included in the GROUP BY clause

choices.label: D
choices.text: You cannot add a new column to the table with LONG as the data type

question.text: What are the distinguishing characteristics of a public synonym rather than a private synonym?
(Choose Two)

choices.label: A
choices.text: Public synonyms can be accessed by name without a schema qualifier.

choices.label: B
choices.text: Public synonyms can be selected from without needing any permissions.

choices.label: C
choices.text: Public synonyms can have the same names as tables or views.

choices.label: D
choices.text: Public synonyms are always visible to all users.
